1.44: As the commonly used sol–gel films are silica, titania and silica/titania hybrid films with refractive index varying from 1.44 to 2.20, we have tried to optimize the triple-layer AR coating with refractive index of individual layer ranging from 1.44 to 2.20.
In this work, silica/titania hybrid films with refractive index varying from 1.44 to 2.20 have been obtained by mixing the starting silica and titania sols together in different proportions.
Silica/titania hybrid film with refractive index varying from 1.44 to 2.20 was prepared by the sol–gel process and applied as film materials for the triple-layer broadband AR coating.
2.2: As the commonly used sol–gel films are silica, titania and silica/titania hybrid films with refractive index varying from 1.44 to 2.20, we have tried to optimize the triple-layer AR coating with refractive index of individual layer ranging from 1.44 to 2.20.
In this work, silica/titania hybrid films with refractive index varying from 1.44 to 2.20 have been obtained by mixing the starting silica and titania sols together in different proportions.
Silica/titania hybrid film with refractive index varying from 1.44 to 2.20 was prepared by the sol–gel process and applied as film materials for the triple-layer broadband AR coating.

2.0: Additionally, the tellurite–based glass system also possess an excellent physical property with optimum value of the refractive index in the range of 2.0–2.5, low phonon energy cut-off (~700 cm-1) and low melting temperature (733 °C).
